posts.author: frogofpeace
posts.content:
Hi all -

long time listener, first time caller

I guess I'm really here to advertise and extend an invitation. Neversummer 4 is a long-standing PvP/PvE persistent world that just made the transition to NWN Enhanced Edition. The hallmark and aspiration of the server is balanced PvP, with six home factions that each offer their own strengths, weaknesses, and playing styles (nature focused, divine, mages, dwarven, dragons, and drow). The server is in the NWN server list as Neversummer 4 EE, or you can direct connect via ns4.ns4ee.com.

The server itself is huge with over 600 areas, including areas for pre-epic and epic adventuring. Lots and lots of custom content in service to balance, so this is not vanilla NWN - most spells, all gear and creatures, and a lot of feat, class, and racial attributes are custom. The modifications are too numerous to mention for a post, but there is a wiki, a website, and a Discord channel with lots and lots of info.  I can tell you we love talking builds, and I myself have turned to the ECB boards for inspiration and help in starting builds to play in NS4. Just a general flavor of some of the broader changes:

1. All prestige classes, a couple main classes, and any classes taken in epics requires a minimum of 5 levels to be taken
2. Each faction has a prestige class that is unique to its faction (for instance, only players in the Ragnar's Kin faction can make a dwarven defender).
3. Factions have other limitations in classes, races, and/or alignments, and there are no alignment changes, so you can't make, for example, a paladin/PM
4. Subraces
5. Reining in of super-abilities like HIPS and stunning fist

What we get is parties of paladins and divine warriors facing off and well-matched against mages, assassins, and undead masters. Battles that literally range across the server. Parties leveling and challenged by epic monsters. Events where you work with your allies to achieve victory and dominance.

So I invite you to check it out. Links are below, and please feel free to PM me if I can help. We look forward to new friends .... and foes

Website: ns4ee.com
Wiki: ns4ee.com/wiki
Discord: Neversummer Enhanced
Direct connect: ns4.ns4ee.com:5121

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I definitely recommend checking out NS4. It was one of my favourite servers in 1.69 and very little has changed in the EE version. Challenging PvM from 1-40 and the most balanced PvP environment I've ever played in (although there are still some OP builds). Due to the various faction restrictions and custom changes I find theory building for NS4 more interesting compared to vanilla NWN.

Another thing to mention in addition to frogofpeace's post is that it's possible to add a permanent +2 or +4 bonus to abilities with books found in monster loot. So in addition to subrace ability changes you could potentially get +4 to all six abilities, although realistically you'll be using +2 books rather than +4 books. As well as increasing the level of build customisation this also makes it possible to create decent builds that are terrible or even impossible to make in vanilla NWN.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Although the highest character I have in NS4 EE is only 27, most things are the same as 1.69 so I think I have a rough idea of how levelling is in EE. Generally 1-30 is easy and can be done solo with no problem, assuming that you know where to go. 30-35 can be done solo with the right build but it's much quicker and safer with a party. 35-40 is a choice between waiting for a party or a very very long solo grind.

At 20 I usually solo in either Frostdale or Sunken Isle, although with a decent build or party I might try harder areas like Skara or Isle Of Dreams.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: Ice Efreets give decent XP although you'll need a lot of Cold DI/DR. There are trolls in Frostdale too but I've never liked levelling there. Sunken Isle is fairly easy for it's CR value, plus it has decent loot if you can kill the bosses. The Merfolk Fishermen have Stunning Fist and Quivering Palm, but as long as you wear the right DR gear none of the mobs in the first area should give you any trouble. Especially if you're a Druid with summons.

posts.author: frogofpeace
posts.content:
Ice efreets are all bludgeon damage, too, so equip a bludge shield and bludge armor. I don't like ice trolls, either, but some people do.

Ride the dragon outside avendell to western slope and head north for mezzosomethings (we just call them mezzos :P) - ant-creatures. Not quite as good xp as efreets, but can get you another couple levels after 20, depending on your ECL. Or go south from western slope to find gnolls - same comment as mezzos.

Two things about NS4: first, it's all about damage resists - pay attention to the type of damage the mob is doing, both physical and elemental. Most armors have physical damage resistance and immunity - equip appropriately, and use buff spells for more DR.

The second is the summons are your friends: Summon Creature, Planar Binding, Gate, Dragon Knight, Mummy Dust are heavily modified. Summons vary by alignment, race, and spell foci of the caster, but can really help. Druid spells in particular are very summons friendly and give lots of options (elemental form is pretty nice, too).
